title: My main Google search page will not turn off Dark Mode. I want it to back to Lght Mode.
content:
Hello Firefox Representative,

I came across an issue that been bothering me and I am hoping somebody can help me with it, or at least give me viable options on how to resolve it. Recently on October 13, 2025 I open up my Firefox browser like I always have. But this time in particular my main Google search screen that have as my default is automatically set to dark mode. I did not make this change, I did not wanted this change, and I want to be able to resolve this issue.

The main issue is when I open my default Google search page and its in dark mode, but the moment I search up anything it automatically reverts back to my light mode that I always set it to. I just want my main Google search page to just be a plain white page.

And please before anybody here gives me any "help" please acknowledge what I have already done, before giving me generic answers.

I went into Firefox settings and have it set to Light Mode and I turn off Dark Mode. I went into the setting and turn off and on Graphic Acceleration to see if that does anything. I even went into the About:Config and selected 1 (which is force light mode).

Now the "only" thing that somewhat work and this is the strange part. When I clear my cookies, the main Google Search screen reverted back to the way it was. So I thought the problem was fix, but the moment I log into my Google Account it instantly reverse back to the Dark Mode. Somebody here is thinking I turn on my dark mode and have it set that way, but I have all the proof I set everything is set to light mode. Basically if I sign out of my Google Account, it magically goes back to the way it was. But I want to be log in, and that is the problem. Does anybody know where in the settings I can fix this, or am I doing something wrong, do I have a cookie somewhere that is doing this, do I have some unknown extension that is being activated that I am not aware of.

Any help you can provide for me will be appreciated.
creator: shadowvoid369

title: Multiple processes
content: I have been using Firefox for many, many years. As of late I find it is constantly slowing or freezing and when I check with taskmanager I find Firefox has opened and is running as many as 85 processes. I have tried the recommended methods of limiting it...but the performance options do not provide the ability to limit processes as set out in the instructions....and changing the browser.tabs.remote.autostart to false also did not work. If I can't fix this, I will have to stop using Firefox. I am using version 144.0

title: Problema de sincronização após reinstalar o Windows 11
content:
Olá,

Recentemente reinstalei o Windows 11 mantendo os meus ficheiros, mas o Firefox foi desinstalado. Após instalar novamente, a minha conta Firefox Sync não sincroniza corretamente todos os dados: favoritos, palavras-passe e histórico desapareceram.

Já tentei iniciar sessão na mesma conta, mas a sincronização não recupera tudo. Isto está a causar perda de dados importantes e torna difícil usar o navegador como antes.

Solicito orientação sobre como restaurar completamente os dados sincronizados e garantir que a conta funcione corretamente mesmo após reinstalações do sistema operativo.

title: About Missing Selenium Ide Extension File
content:
I use the Selenium IDE plugin for my job about 1 year. But yesterday I encountered a problem. I saved the project I was working on and left work on Friday(10.10.2025). And for a year, I kept saving it to my desktop. Yesterday(13.10.2025) morning I restarted my computer because it was running very slow. When I turned on the computer, I saw that the Selenium IDE project file I was working on was missing. I say "lost" because when I had it checked by the system team at the company I work for, it didn't appear to have been deleted. Also, I don't have any files with the ".side" extension in the recycle bin. I tried to find it with programs like Recuva and Everything, but it is not found. This is a very important file for me and my work. Can you help me please?

File name: MevaTest.side Selenium Ide extension version: 3.17.4

title: Be descriptive. Saying “playing video on YouTube is always choppy” will help us understand the issue better than saying “something is wrong” or “the app is broken”. Subject:
content:
k your question Illustration of community Our Community is here to help Kindness is at the heart of our community. Our volunteers are happy to share their time and Firefox knowledge with you.

Learn More

Helpful Tip icon Helpful Tip! Follow through. Sometimes, our volunteers would ask you for more information or to test out certain scenarios. The sooner you can do this, the sooner they would know how to fix it.

Be nice. Our volunteers are Mozilla users just like you, who take the time out of their day to help.

Be descriptive. Saying “playing video on YouTube is always choppy” will help us understand the issue better than saying “something is wrong” or “the app is broken”.

title: Tab groups pain
content:
First, why does the "recently closed tabs" doesn't work if you close an entire firefox window?

second, why isn't there a place to search through your tab groups?

I just accidentally closed a firefox window with a lot of tabs, including unnamed tab groups.

This is a pain for all browsers, but firefox took it a step further.

There is a "recently closed tab" page which is really convenient, until you need it most when you accidentally close multiple ones. On top of that, I lost multiple unnamed group tabs.

Am I missing something, or is the experience still subpar? I've been a power user of firefox for years now, and I get why I get clowned by chrome users ngl.

title: Fix "The bookmarks and history system will not be functional" error message
content:
I have been a Firefox user for many, many years. I started getting the Subject message: "The bookmarks and history system will not be functional" error message this evening. I started to "Fix" this error based on the Mozilla Support page. Actually, I first tried restarting my computer and that didn't correct the problem. I then noticed I could "sign off" Firefox which I thought I'd do and sign back in. I didn't notice until after the fact that my Firefox account was tied to a very old email address I once used that is no longer active "commish3@bellsouth.net". When I tried signing back into Firefox using that old email account, it said a security code would be sent to that old email address. Problem is I no longer have access to that email account.

1) Is there a way I can sign back in and have a security code sent to my current email address: tad3.dickinson@gmail.com ?

2) Can you assist with restoring my bookmarks. Again, years of building these bookmarks that I'm very dependent on.

Thanks, Tad Dickinson
